title: Reporter/Digital Network Intelligence Analyst
name: michael bennett
description: Member of the Research and Development team that conducts research and reporting on elements operating against interests of the United States. As an analyst I assist with SIGINT development and reporting involving multiple targets which have received positive feedback from numerous high-level customers within the intelligence community. Work with DNI communication developing additional targets through research including collaborating with other analysts from across the IC.

title: Digital Network Intelligence Analyst
name: michael bennett
description: Indoctrinated in to the National Security Agency January 2008. Assisted in quality control on mission critical reports in support of Operation ENDURING FREEDOM. Senior SGA analyst solely responsible for the detailed documentation of targets of interest telecommunications network. Developed network analysis to locate and identify targets of interest. Provided imagery used to identify and understand the telecommunication infrastructure and technologies used by a variety of targets of interest. Produced reporting and imagery to enable sustained collection and provide and intelligence through product reports, Requests for Information (RFI), and appropriate databases. Oversaw the Division-level digital network mission while actively engaging forward deployed elements, and supporting unit leaders and commanders with constant analysis of target communication in support of Operation IRAQI FREEDOM. Awarded the Joint Service Commendation Medal for stellar service during OPERATION IRAQI FREEDOM. Hand selected to TDY as a

title: Liasion
company: OGA) Counter Terrorism Center (CTC), Signals Intelligence Directorate
name: michael bennett
description: Provided detailed SIGINT expertise and analysis in support of targeting operations of high-value individuals. Effectively synchronized the flow of intelligence information between SIGINT assets in theater and the NSA enterprise regarding high-valued targets within various insurgent groups. Provided time-sensitive reach back support for forward deployed analysts resulting in enhanced cooperation and support of targets of interest. I produced time-sensitive reports in support of combat and development missions.

description: Advanced through positions of increased leadership and strategic/operational responsibility based on consistently exceeding goals expectations. Recognized as visionary, innovative, and flawless planner. Recruited by organizational senior executive to lead and turn-around performance of a diverse 40-member team conducting detailed operational project planning utilizing various military assets to support federal, state and local governments and agencies for air and homeland defense activities. By end of first year my Division became the focal point for entire organization and led strategic planning and time sensitive project management activities achieving/exceeding corporate vision. Through proactive leadership, created cohesive team developing 300+ individual detailed project management plans nation-wide (involving 2,000+ people, 30+ individual locations, three countries, 48 states, three territories, and $10B+ in resources). Led detailed plan development, crisis management, training, resource reporting, project management, team building, planning strategy, facilities and resources management, public speaking, and information technology. • Benchmarked corporate strategy/strategic vision for #1 joint venture: presented to senior executives • Reduced disaster response aviation flight safety incidents during British Petroleum oil spill by 500% through innovative multi-agency procedures (Corporate benchmark); approved by Secretary/DHS. • Developed/led planning of 300+ projects/achieving efficiency improvements; saving $20M+ annually.

title: Colonel - Chief, Strategy Division
name: Mark Maier

description: Selected ahead of peers to lead organizations most crucial division for strategic thinking/leadership/ planning, long-range, organizational assessment and global operations by a diverse 20-member team. Provided strategic vision and planning guidance to larger 600-person organization for Air and Homeland Defense activities supporting federal, state and local governments and agencies. Developed 150+ strategic plans (25%+ directly approved by very senior U.S. government Departmental officials); four air campaign plans, and 200+ strategic vision/planning documents. • Reduced strategic guidance planning cycle by 75%; developed highly effective method to insert modified strategic guidance into the appropriate operational phase during defense support to civil authorities strategic planning, increasing speed to employ critical life-saving activities into effected areas by 48hrs. As the lead strategic planner during organizations busiest year ever, I developed 20 national, 12 state, and 50+ Homeland Defense operational strategic/project management plans supporting Presidential and disaster relief activities (10+ hurricanes, 3 major wildland fires, & 2 major floods) which saved countless lives. • Developed organization’s first-ever media relations plan; Informed 10M+ people through actively engaging national and local media organizations: American people kept informed on relief support efforts.

description: Led and directed mid-scale project management activities, multi-site operations, and supervised diverse 150-person team for operations management of organization performing execution-level Air and Homeland defense activities. Led change management by developing NORAD’s first-ever merger of two 24/7 air and homeland defense organizations during major contingency operations (no fail/on time): Benchmark. • Rapidly increased combat capability by 500%+ in the wake of September 11, 2001, by developing first-ever rapid integration of radar/radio infrastructure into NORAD’s legacy command and control system. • Lead command and control project planner delivering first advanced technology C2 system in 20+ years (increased capabilities/improved operations/decreased maintenance costs/enhanced user interface).

description: July 2009 thru Present: Currently assigned to another agency - Greater New York City Area July 2004 thru June 2009: Defense Intelligence Analysis Center (DIAC) at Joint Base Anacostia-Bolling (JBAB) in Washington, DC Iraqi Ministry of Interior/ Intelligence and Counterterrorism Directorate - Baghdad, Iraq Office of the Defense Attaché to the US Ambassador at: US Embassy-Cairo, Egypt; US Embassy-Bogota, Colombia; US Embassy-Santiago, Chile "Work relentlessly, accomplish much, and be more than you seem." להיות יעיל ללא רחם בעבודה, מקבלים הרבה הישגים, תמיד "להיות" יותר מאשר אחרים תופסים אותך להיות. Soyez d'une efficacité redoutable au travail, obtenir beaucoup de réalisations, toujours «être» plus que d'autres vous perçoivent l'être. آیا کاری که دیگران مایل به انجام آن نیست.موفقیت کارهای سخت را تکمیل کنید.تبدیل شدن به "ادامه" نسبت به افراد دیگر فکر می کنم شما هستند. Seien Sie bei Ihrer Arbeit unerbittlich, viel erreichen, und immer "sein" mehr, als Sie zu sein scheinen. Будьте безжалостно эффективным в работе, стремиться к достижению много, и всегда "быть" больше, чем другие воспринимают вас быть. Ser despiadadamente eficientes en el trabajo, lograr mucho, y siempre "ser" más que otros perciben que seas.

description: When thinking about successful organizations, everyone knows about the US Navy & Marine Corps FA-18 Flight Demonstration Squadron, the BLUE ANGELS – who have taken on the mantra of being “Ambassadors of Good Will.” Their decades long history (since 1946) of consistantly building upon a solid track-record of amazing successful achievement can be broken down to a four-step process: • BELIEF LEVEL – with vision and clarity they sustain growth in a high level of belief in four areas: their PROCESSES, their PRODUCT(S), their PEOPLE, and their PURPOSE. • BRIEFING – they’ve compiled a detailed PLAN, every part of which contains inherent FOCUS on the end result and is COMMUNICATED succinctly as possible, in clear and understandable terms. • CONTRACTS – every member of their team has a high level of TRUST in the competencies of their fellows, is committed to the flawless EXECUTION of their assigned tasks, and holds a strong sense of COMMITMENT to their mission. • DEBRIEFING – after every “performance” – regardless of it being a rehearsal or one of the over 70 air shows performed before millions of spectators every year – every member of the team, without regard to rank or experience level differences, acknowledges mistakes that they’ve made and clearly states the corrective actions that they will take to eliminate the possibility of repetition of those errors. With each and every subsequent DEBRIEFING – which assesses their strengths and weaknesses, fosters discipline both individually and collectively, and instills a high level of accountability – the BELIEF LEVEL of the team members in themselves and in each other grows ever greater, liberating them to attain increasingly higher levels of competency individually and continually exceed previous expectations together as a team. Members of the BLUE ANGELS are constantly heard saying: "I'm happy to be here." They're all enthusiastically committed to continuous exemplary performance of their assigned tasks.

description: active duty/active reserve status 1-73 thru 6-04 Began as an enlisted Reconnaissance Marine; and, then transitioned from SSgt (E6) to 2Lt (O1) through the Enlisted Commissioning Program (ECP). Assignments included: DAO-Saigon (South Vietnam, Cambodia, and US SAG, Thailand) serving under: Col. Nicholas M. Trapnell Jr, USMC - NOV 1973 to APR 1974 LtCol. Charles A. Barscow, USMC - NOV 1973 to JUL 1974 Col. Paul L. Siegmund, USMC - APR 1974 to FEB 1975 Col. Eugene R. Howard Jr, USMC - JAN 1975 to APR 1975 LtCol. William E. McKinstry, USMC - JUL 1974 to APR 1975 16 Dec 1973 - 23 Feb 1974 Battle of Phnom Penh 27 Apr 1974 - 2 May 1974 Battle of Svay Rieng 12 Dec 1974 - 6 Jan 1975 Battle of Phuoc Long 3 Mar 1975 - 11 Mar 1975 Battle of Ban Me Thuot 28 Mar 1975 - 30 Mar 1975 Da Nang, RVN evacuation 9 Apr 1975 - 22 Apr 1975 Xuan Loc, RVN 30 Apr 1975 OPERATION FREQUENT WIND-Saigon evacuation 15 May 1975 OPERATION MAYAGUEZ-Koh Tang Island, Cambodia 24 - 25 April 1980 OPERATION EAGLE CLAW-near Tabas, Iran 25 Oct - 15 Dec 1983 OPERATION URGENT FURY-Grenada 20 Dec 1989 - 12 Jan 1990 OPERATION JUST CAUSE-Panama 2 Aug 1990 - 28 Feb 1991 OPERATION DESERT STORM-Saudi Arabia & Iraq 9 Dec 1992 - 4 May 1993 OPERATION RESTORE HOPE-Somalia 19 Sept 1994 31 Mar 1995 OPERATION RESTORE DEMOCRACY-Haiti 24 Mar 1999 - 10 June 1999 OPERATION NOBLE ANVIL-Yugoslavia (deployed as a Forward Air Controller directing US-led NATO bombing missions, which led to the withdrawal of Yugoslav forces from Kosovo) 1 May 2003 - 31 Oct 2003 OPERATION ENDURING FREEDOM-Afghanistan (deployed in support of the Global War on Terrorism) 1 Nov 2003 - 30 Apr 2004 OPERATION IRAQI FREEDOM (deployed as a Senior Intelligence/Policy Advisor at Iraqi Ministry of Interior/ Intelligence and Counterterrorism Directorate - Baghdad, Iraq) 1 July 2004 - transitioned to a civilian administrative role within DoD.
